title: Gen Z Protest Against Social Media Ban
description: Government has banned TikTok and restricted social media following protests. Youth are organizing through VPNs and encrypted messaging. International human rights groups express concern while security agencies claim necessity.
source: Based on recent social media restrictions during Nepal protests
recentNews: September 2024 - Nepal government restricted social media platforms during youth-led protests

choices.text: Maintain ban citing national security and public order concerns
choices.outcome: Security agencies support you but international criticism intensifies. Youth find creative ways to organize resistance, making them more determined.
choices.constitutional_implication: Social media bans violate Article 17 (Freedom of Expression) without proper legal justification and due process.

choices.text: Lift ban immediately and apologize for overreach
choices.outcome: Youth celebrate but security agencies question your resolve. Opposition calls you weak while civil society praises democratic values.
choices.constitutional_implication: Restoring freedom of expression upholds constitutional rights and democratic principles.

choices.text: Create regulated social media policy with content monitoring
choices.outcome: Compromise satisfies neither side completely. Tech-savvy youth circumvent restrictions while conservatives demand stronger action.
choices.constitutional_implication: Reasonable regulation of speech can be constitutional if proportionate and legally justified.

title: Threats to Constituent Assembly Building
description: Angry protesters threaten to storm and burn the Constituent Assembly building, echoing past incidents. Historical footage shows actual attacks on government buildings. Security forces await your orders.
source: Based on historical attacks on government buildings and current protest threats
recentNews: Historical reference: CA building has been target of political protests multiple times

choices.text: Deploy armed forces with shoot-on-sight orders to protect the building
choices.outcome: Building saved but democracy dies. International isolation follows as images of military firing on citizens spread globally.
choices.constitutional_implication: Using excessive force against protesters violates fundamental rights and proportionality principles.

choices.text: Allow protesters to enter but ensure firefighters and ambulances are ready
choices.outcome: Symbol of democracy burns but no lives lost. International community praises restraint while conservatives call you weak.
choices.constitutional_implication: Prioritizing human life over property while allowing peaceful protest aligns with constitutional values.

choices.text: Meet protesters at the building entrance and negotiate personally
choices.outcome: Historic confrontation that either makes you a legend or ends your career. Media captures every word of this defining moment.
choices.constitutional_implication: Direct democratic engagement respects citizens' right to petition government and peaceful assembly.

title: Record Deaths on Everest Due to Permit Corruption
description: 21 climbers have died this season due to fake permits sold to unqualified climbers. International climbing community demands action. Your Tourism Minister's family runs the permit processing company.
source: Based on recurring Everest climbing deaths and permit irregularities
recentNews: 2023-2024: Record number of climbing deaths on Everest due to overcrowding and unqualified climbers

choices.text: Protect Tourism Minister - blame deaths on climate change and bad weather
choices.outcome: International climbing boycott destroys tourism industry. Bodies pile up while your minister builds Swiss mansion from permit fees.
choices.constitutional_implication: Protecting corruption while people die violates duty of care and honest governance obligations.

choices.text: Arrest Tourism Minister publicly and overhaul entire permit system
choices.outcome: International community applauds action. Climbing deaths decrease but tourism revenue drops temporarily during system overhaul.
choices.constitutional_implication: Ensuring accountability and public safety is core governmental duty under rule of law.

choices.text: Create international oversight committee for Everest permits
choices.outcome: Foreign involvement angers nationalists but saves lives. Nepal loses some control but gains credibility in adventure tourism.
choices.constitutional_implication: International cooperation for public safety is permissible under sovereign decision-making.

title: Earthquake Relief Fund Investigation Reveals Massive Corruption
description: Audit reveals $1.5 billion in earthquake relief funds was diverted through fake NGOs. Earthquake victims still live in temporary shelters 8 years later while relief coordinators own luxury properties.
source: Based on ongoing issues with 2015 earthquake relief distribution
recentNews: Ongoing investigations into earthquake relief fund distribution inefficiencies

choices.text: Blame previous governments and distance yourself from the scandal
choices.outcome: Political survival tactic that fools no one. International donors lose faith in Nepal's governance entirely. No new aid comes.
choices.constitutional_implication: While not illegal, this undermines accountability principles expected in democratic governance.

choices.text: Launch massive anti-corruption drive and recover stolen funds
choices.outcome: Herculean task that makes enemies but restores faith. Some funds recovered, major politicians arrested, institutions strengthened.
choices.constitutional_implication: Anti-corruption enforcement is constitutional duty and enhances rule of law.

choices.text: Establish transparent blockchain system for all future aid distribution
choices.outcome: Cutting-edge solution that impresses tech community but confuses older politicians. Future aid is corruption-proof but slower to distribute.
choices.constitutional_implication: Technology solutions for transparency enhance democratic accountability and good governance.

title: New India Border Restrictions Following China Deal
description: India has quietly imposed 'enhanced security checks' at all border crossings after Nepal signed infrastructure deals with China. Essential supplies are delayed, fuel prices rising.
source: Based on recurring Nepal-India border tensions over China relations
recentNews: Ongoing tensions between Nepal's China engagement and India's security concerns

choices.text: Cancel China deals immediately and apologize to India
choices.outcome: Borders reopen but you look like a puppet state. China cancels all investments. Opposition calls you traitor to sovereignty.
choices.constitutional_implication: While legal, surrendering to foreign pressure undermines national sovereignty principles.

choices.text: Mobilize public for 'Dignity and Sovereignty Movement' against blockade
choices.outcome: Patriotic fervor rises but people suffer. You become symbol of resistance or stubborn fool. International community watches carefully.
choices.constitutional_implication: Defending sovereignty is constitutional duty, though public welfare must be considered.

choices.text: Seek international mediation through UN and propose trilateral dialogue
choices.outcome: Diplomatic solution that may work but takes time. India resents internationalization while China stays neutral. Long-term approach.
choices.constitutional_implication: Multilateral diplomacy aligns with peaceful coexistence and international law principles.
